title: Complete React Development
description: A practical course covering React fundamentals to advanced patterns, with projects. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. outcomes: Master Python programming from a data science perspective
Perform powerful data analysis using Pandas and NumPy
Create stunning data visualizations with Matplotlib and Seaborn
Understand and apply core statistics and probability concepts
Clean and preprocess real-world datasets for accurate insights
Work on real-life projects
Use Jupyter Notebooks for data-driven development

curriculum.title: Week 1 - Python Foundations for Data Science
curriculum.content:
• Python for Data Science: Overview & Setup
• Variables, Data Types & Type Casting
• Strings, Lists, Tuples, Sets & Dictionaries
• Conditional Statements & Loops
• Functions in Python - Definition & Usage

curriculum.title: Week 2 - Data Analysis & Visualization (Pandas + EDA)
curriculum.content:
• Getting Started with Pandas,
• Core Data Structures: Series & DataFrames
• Creating, Modifying, Selecting & Filtering DataFrames
• Data Cleaning, Preprocessing & Transformation
• Grouping, Merging & Joining DataFrames
• Working with CSV & Excel Files
• Exploratory Data Analysis (Univariate & Bivariate)
• Data Visualization with Matplotlib & Seaborn

curriculum.title: Week 3 - Statistics for Data Science
curriculum.content:
• Descriptive Statistics: Central Tendency
• Correlation & Covariance Analysis
• Hypothesis Testing: Z-test, T-test, Chi-Square
• Confidence Intervals & P-values
• Statistics Case Study: Real-world dataset analysis

curriculum.title: Week 4 - SQL for Data Science
curriculum.content:
Introduction to Databases & SQL
• SELECT Statements & Filtering Data
• Aggregations: COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX
• GROUP BY & HAVING Clauses
• Joins: INNER, LEFT, RIGHT, FULL
• Subqueries & Common Table Expressions (CTEs)
• SQL Case Study: Data Insights

curriculum.title: Week 5 - Machine Learning Foundations
curriculum.content:
• Introduction to Machine Learning: Supervised & Unsupervised
• Regression: Linear, Decision Tree, Random Forest
• Classification: Logistic, Decision Tree, Random Forest
• Unsupervised Learning: K-Means Clustering<

curriculum.title: Week 6 - Feature Engineering & AI / Deep Learning Essentials
curriculum.content:
• Feature Engineering (Hands-On):
• Feature Selection, Scaling & Normalization
• Encoding Categorical Features
• Dimensionality Reduction Basics (PCA)
• Neural Networks & Deep Learning:
• Introduction to Neural Networks & Perceptrons
• Activation Functions: Sigmoid, ReLU, Tanh
• Forward & Backward Propagation Concepts
• Hands-On: Train a Neural Network on MNIST
• NLP, Large Language Models & AI:
• Introduction to NLP & Applications
• Large Language Models (LLMs): Concepts & Use Cases
• Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Overview

curriculum.title: Week 7 - Data Storytelling & Power BI
curriculum.content:
• Data Storytelling Framework: Findings → Impact → Recommendation
• Power BI: Connecting Data, Models & Visualizations
• Interactive Dashboards: Filters, Slicers & Drill-Through Techniques
• DAX Basics for Calculations
• Portfolio Preparation: Showcasing Projects
• Career Launchpad: Resume Building & Interview Preparation

curriculum.title: Week 8 - Capstone Projects
curriculum.content:
Python Project: Automate Data Cleaning & Preprocessing
• SQL Project: Data Insights Dashboard
• ML Project 1: Customer Churn Prediction (Classification)
• ML Project 2: House Price Prediction (Regression)
• AI Project: RAG-based Question Answering Chatbot
• Power BI Project: Interactive Sales Dashboard

requirements: No prior experience in data science is needed
Basic computer skills and internet access
Willingness to learn and solve real-world problems
Curiosity and consistency — that's all you really need!
Stable internet connection for accessing course content
Basic familiarity with using the terminal/command line (helpful but not required)
